documents.summary: This document outlines best practices and formatting standards for technical documentation, providing guidance on headings, images, links, code blocks, and UI navigation instructions.

documents.title: Write a Docker guide
documents.description: Learn how to write guides for learning about Docker, with Docker.
documents.summary: This document outlines the standards and best practices for creating Docker usage guides and tutorials, including structural outlines and formatting rules. It provides instructions on metadata, repository organization, and technical writing style to ensure high-quality documentation.

documents.title: Docker terminology
documents.description: Docker specific terminology and definitions
documents.summary: This document provides a glossary of terms and stylistic guidelines for terminology used within the Docker and Docker Compose ecosystem.

documents.title: Recommended word list
documents.description: Recommended word list for Technical documentation
documents.summary: This document provides specific wording recommendations and terminology standards to ensure consistency and clarity across technical documentation. It lists preferred terms, words to avoid, and guidelines for addressing users and describing UI elements.

documents.title: UI elements in content
documents.description: How to refer to and write about UI elements in technical documentation.
documents.summary: This document provides formatting and terminology guidelines for consistently and clearly referencing user interface elements in technical documentation.

documents.title: Grammar and style
documents.description: Grammar and style guidelines for technical documentation
documents.summary: This document provides comprehensive style and formatting guidelines for writing Docker documentation to ensure consistency in grammar, capitalization, and punctuation.

documents.title: Voice and tone
documents.description: Docker's voice and tone
documents.summary: This document defines Docker's voice and tone guidelines for documentation and UI copy, focusing on the 4Cs: correct, concise, complete, and clear. it establishes principles for inclusive, honest, and positive communication designed to empower developers.

documents.title: Build, tag, and publish an image
documents.description: This concept page will teach you how to build, tag, and publish an image to Docker Hub or any other registry
documents.summary: This document explains how to build images from a Dockerfile, apply structured naming tags, and publish the results to a container registry.

documents.title: Writing a Dockerfile
documents.description: This concept page will teach you how to create image using Dockerfile.
documents.summary: This document explains the purpose and core instructions of a Dockerfile while providing a step-by-step tutorial on creating one to build a container image.

documents.title: Multi-container applications
documents.description: This concept page will teach you the significance of multi-container application and how it is different from single-container application
documents.summary: This document explains the limitations of managing multi-container applications with individual Docker commands and demonstrates how Docker Compose simplifies orchestration through a single configuration file.

documents.title: Using the build cache
documents.description: This concept page will teach you about the build cache, what changes invalidate the cache and how to effectively use the build cache.
documents.summary: This document explains how the Docker build cache works and provides practical techniques for optimizing Dockerfiles to maximize layer reuse and reduce build times. It specifically demonstrates how to restructure commands for Node.js applications to prevent unnecessary re-installation of dependencies.

documents.title: Persisting container data
documents.description: This concept page will teach you the significance of data persistence in Docker
documents.summary: This document explains the concept of Docker volumes and provides step-by-step instructions for persisting data across container lifecycles. It covers volume creation, management via CLI commands, and inspection using the Docker Desktop Dashboard through a PostgreSQL database example.

documents.title: Understanding the image layers
documents.description: This concept page will teach you about the layers of container image.
documents.summary: This document explains the technical foundations of Docker image layers and union filesystems, demonstrating how images are constructed through immutable layers. It provides a step-by-step guide on manually creating and extending images using the docker container commit command to illustrate these concepts.

documents.title: Multi-stage builds
documents.description: This concept page will teach you about the purpose of the multi-stage build and its benefits
documents.summary: This document explains the concept of Docker multi-stage builds and provides a step-by-step guide to optimizing container images by separating build dependencies from the final runtime environment.

documents.title: Publishing and exposing ports
documents.description: This concept page will teach you the significance of publishing and exposing ports in Docker
documents.summary: This document explains the concept and practical application of port publishing in Docker to enable access to services running inside isolated containers using the CLI and Docker Compose.

documents.title: What is a container?
documents.description: What is a container? This concept page will teach you about containers and provide a quick hands-on where you will run your first container.
documents.summary: This document explains the core concepts and benefits of containerization while providing a hands-on walkthrough for running and managing containers via Docker Desktop and the CLI.

documents.title: Sharing local files with containers
documents.description: This concept page will teach you the various storage options available in Docker and their common usage.
documents.summary: This document explains how to use Docker bind mounts to share files and directories between a host machine and a container, including differences between volumes and mounts, permission settings, and implementation steps.

documents.title: What is a registry?
documents.description: What is a registry? This Docker Concept will explain what a registry is, explore their interoperability, and have you interact with registries.
documents.summary: This document explains the concept of container registries and provides a step-by-step tutorial on how to create, build, tag, and push container images to Docker Hub.

documents.title: Overriding container defaults
documents.description: This concept page will teach you how to override the container defaults using the `docker run` command.
documents.summary: This document explains how to customize Docker container behavior by overriding default image settings like network ports, environment variables, and resource limits. It provides practical instructions for using docker run flags and Docker Compose to tailor containers to specific requirements.

documents.title: What is Docker?
documents.description: Get an in-depth overview of the Docker platform including what it can be used for, the architecture it employs, and its underlying technology.
documents.summary: This document provides a high-level conceptual overview of the Docker platform, its architecture, and the core components used to build, ship, and run containerized applications.

documents.title: Get Docker
documents.description: Download and install Docker on the platform of your choice, including Mac, Linux, or Windows.
documents.summary: This document provides a high-level introduction to Docker, explaining its role in separating applications from infrastructure to accelerate software delivery and deployment.

documents.title: What is Docker Compose?
documents.description: What is Docker Compose?
documents.summary: This document introduces Docker Compose as a tool for defining and running multi-container applications using a declarative YAML configuration file. It provides a practical walkthrough for starting and stopping a stack of services including a web application and a database.

documents.title: What is an image?
documents.description: What is an image
documents.summary: This document explains the fundamental concepts of Docker container images, including their immutable and layered structure, and provides instructions for searching, pulling, and inspecting images using Docker Desktop and the CLI.

documents.title: Build and push your first image
documents.description: This concept page will teach you how to build and push your first image
documents.summary: This document provides a hands-on guide for creating, building, and pushing container images to Docker Hub using both command-line and Visual Studio Code interfaces. It also defines key concepts such as Docker registries, official images, and Dockerfiles.

documents.title: Develop with containers
documents.description: This concept page will teach you how to develop with containers
documents.summary: This tutorial demonstrates how to develop applications using Docker Desktop and Docker Compose, focusing on setting up a multi-container environment and performing live code updates. It guides users through cloning a project, running a full-stack environment, and modifying both backend and frontend components with immediate feedback.

documents.title: Get Docker Desktop
documents.description: This concept page will teach you download Docker Desktop and install it on Windows, Mac, and Linux
documents.summary: This document provides a walk-through for installing Docker Desktop and running an initial container to introduce users to container management. It covers basic CLI commands for starting containers and explores the Docker Desktop interface for monitoring and inspecting active services.

documents.title: What's next
documents.description: Explore step-by-step guides to hep you understand core Docker concepts, building images, and running containers.
documents.summary: This document introduces an interactive assistant designed to provide instant support for Docker-related inquiries, covering commands, concepts, and troubleshooting.

documents.title: Part 3: Share the application
documents.description: Sharing your image you built for your example application so you can run it else where and other developers can use it
documents.summary: This document explains how to run a containerized application and describes the difference between binding ports to the loopback interface versus all host interfaces.

documents.title: Part 2: Update the application
documents.description: Making changes to your application
documents.summary: This tutorial explains how to update a containerized application by modifying source code, rebuilding images, and managing the container lifecycle through stopping and removing existing instances.

documents.title: Part 4: Persist the DB
documents.description: Making your DB persistent in your application
documents.summary: This document explains container filesystem isolation and demonstrates how to persist data across container restarts and removals using Docker volumes.

documents.title: Part 1: Containerize an application
documents.description: Follow this step-by-step guide to learn how to create and run a containerized application using Docker
documents.summary: This document provides a step-by-step tutorial on containerizing a Node.js application by creating a Dockerfile, building an image, and running it as a container. It explains fundamental Docker commands and concepts such as port mapping, detached mode, and container management.

documents.title: Part 7: Use Docker Compose
documents.description: Using Docker Compose for multi-container applications
documents.summary: This document explains how to use Docker Compose to define and manage multi-container applications through a YAML configuration file. documents.title: Educational resources

documents.summary: This document provides a comprehensive list of educational resources, including training programs, hosted labs, books, and online courses for Docker and Kubernetes.

documents.title: Part 5: Use bind mounts
documents.description: Using bind mounts in our application
documents.summary: This document explains how to use Docker bind mounts to synchronize source code between a host machine and a container for rapid local development.

documents.title: Part 8: Image-building best practices
documents.description: Tips for building images for your application
documents.summary: This document explains how to optimize Docker images by understanding image layers, leveraging layer caching, and implementing multi-stage builds. It provides techniques to reduce build times and final image size for more efficient container development.

documents.title: Part 6: Multi-container apps
documents.description: Using more than one container in your application
documents.summary: This document explains how to set up and connect multiple containers using Docker networking, specifically focusing on integrating a MySQL database with an application.

documents.title: Deploy your Docker setup

documents.title: Communication and information gathering

documents.summary: This document outlines recommended next steps for learners after completing a Docker workshop, covering topics such as container orchestration, the CNCF ecosystem, and advanced educational resources.

documents.summary: This document provides guidance on managing user access and permissions within a Docker organization by identifying accounts and strategically assigning roles and team structures.
